New Records: Hardik Pandya hit a half-century off 27 balls
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma became Shakib al Hasan's 50th T20 World Cup wicket
Virat Kohli reached 37, including a four and three sixes
Hardik Pandya saw India home with a half-century
Jasprit Bumrah made his inevitable breakthrough, tempting Najmul Hossain Shanto to the hands of Arshdeep Singh for 40 in the 16th over
Post-Match Reflections: India thus continue their unbeaten run, having seen off Ireland, Pakistan, USA, and Afghanistan - with their match against Canada washed out
Bangladesh, meanwhile, knew they needed a win to continue their progress in the tournament, having lost their opening Super Eights match to Australia
Miscellaneous Highlights: India outplayed Bangladesh with a clinical win to make it two wins out of two in the Super Eight phase
Bangladesh mustered some fire in their response but not quite enough, starting slowly and never able to catch up
Others: The action continued in a high-scoring encounter in Antigua
The scoreboard read 196/5 for India and 146/8 for Bangladesh
